reviews.text: Food was fresh and delicious. The customer service was great.
Store is clean. Friendly staff. Food is delicious. Highly recommending to try.
This place was really good and the service was amazing! Highly recommend this place.
Great food!
Great experience! Yummy food, fast service, kind staff. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more!
Very good butter chicken and nan. food is very nice. Staff is friendly
Delicious chicken tikka masala and garlic naan! A great Indian spot in crown heights. I‚Äôll definitely be back.
Delicious! Great people and food. Very welcoming hospitality.
great food loved the chicken korma
baddest service ever i have

I had a disappointing experience with their customer service. It felt like they were more focused on making a quick sale than on building a lasting relationship with customers. I hope they improve, because good service is what brings customers back.
Service was very fast. I wish I got a free naan with chicken curry and rice but that's what is is. Recommend it.

We‚Äôve been getting take-out from here for years and it‚Äôs consistently tasty. The portions are large and the ingredients, to my tastebuds, are fresh and feel like authentic Indian cuisine. Plus, the staff here are friendly, generous, and efficient.
Great food! Freindly staff.
Great food and store is very clean

Came here with a few of my friends to eat, We had to get the essentials, butter chicken, naan, chili chicken, and you can‚Äôt forget the mango lassi. It was simply beautiful. You could taste the culture in the food and you could tell the staff really cares. My favorite part was the chili chicken because I enjoyed the fried aspect of it. If you are in the area please stop by for some affordable Indian food. This is good stuff. Best in Brooklyn. I MEAN IT!
delicious food! highly recommend!!
Tried the malai kofta and lamb vindaloo. They were both very bland and the vindaloo was not spicy? Disappointing and the service was poor.

A few disappointing aspects that were unfortunate given the food was great.

1. On arrival he gave us bottled water and proceeded to charge us $3.9 for them. Really not on. Ask your guests what they want and if you are just given bottled water it should be free. Felt a bit sleazy.

2. When we put two cards down to split the bill he refused. Demanded 1 card.

3. When we signed and paid. When he collected the bill he opened it in front of us to see the tip.

Just not a New York standard at all or should I say not a standard we should let slide in this great city of food.

But as mentioned food was great.

We were the only 2 people in the restaurant. Quite a few uber eats type pickups while we were there.

I‚Äôve been getting my food from Dhania for a while now, and every single visit feels like coming home. The food is consistently delicious ‚Äì fresh, flavorful, and made with care. Whether it‚Äôs a quiet weekday meal or a weekend treat, Dhania never disappoints.

What really sets this place apart, though, is the people. Mr. Chowdhury, the manager, is one of the kindest and most helpful people I‚Äôve met in the restaurant world. He genuinely cares about his customers and always goes the extra mile to make sure everything is perfect.

The staff are incredibly warm and proactive ‚Äì they check in to see if you need anything, always offer water with a smile, and treat you like family. It's those little touches that make all the difference.

Food 4
service 0
atmosphere 2

I have first time seen waiter trying to upsell food so desperately. Bangladeshi guy gave us water bottles without even asking and 2 bottles not just one each for 1.99.

after that he asked me at least 5 time to order something else instead of just bringing what I have ordered.

Too annoying waiter and he was taking someones order on phone and he was literally yelling lady‚Äôs full card details. food was okay but prefer to get it delivered if you really really wanna try.

From Texas With LOVE for DHANIA!
I am from TX where South Asian food is in competition to be better.
6 ****** Rating, Why?
I am an Expert of Bengali/Indian/Pakistani food due to my involvement to provide bi-weekly food to our congregations of up to 500 members.
Our food is mainly Bengali/Indian/Pakistani dishes and some outside items like salads/sweets etc.
I mostly cook the main dishes MYSELF.

During my visit to NY I dined in few restaurants. I never ate in any NY restaurants before.
Dera rest: C+; 3 star
Lahore rest: B-; 3.5 star
Kababish: C-; 2 star
Alibaba Kabab near Bufalo: B+; 4 star
Few fast-food restaurants.

Now the Main subject DHANIA restaurant, A++; 6 Star
Restaurant is Very Clean, Nice atmosphere.
Food came in reasonable time. If food comes quickly then thats not good for S. Asian food.
Cauliflower was fantastic!
Samosas were very good! Chatney awesome.
Chicken Tikka was great!
Biriyani & butter chicken was Excellent!
Naan was fine & soft! Not hard or burned as some other places.

Since I ordered catering for my congregation from many restaurants in Houston, I became an expert in S. Asian food.
Dhania really surpassed my expectations and surprised me in NY.
Wish them the best.
Keep serving the best food!
Delicious food, wonderful people. Thoroughly enjoyed enjoyed!!
Nice and delicious food
I love this restaurant. The food is so amazing!!! Everyone is always so nice. You have to come if you‚Äôre in Crown Heights!
Great taste, great atmosphere and really delicious food
Garlic naan is awesome. Food is very good. Staff is very friendly.
Food is great! Especially nan bread.

My boyfriend and I order from Dhania at least once a month. Over the past few years we've been able to try most of their menu and it's all delicious. Staff are friendly and communicative and our order is always ready promptly. Not sure what we'd do without this neighborhood gem!

Everything here is fantastic but the Naan is awesome. We love both the garlic and the plain. This place is so cute and one of our frequent weeknight stops. The staff and owner are so friendly and accommodating. Will continue to come here.

Extremely disappointed with this restaurant. Not only was the food terrible, but the staff‚Äôs behavior was shockingly rude and unprofessional. They charged $3 plus tax for a single roti, which is usually just $1 and naan price is 2$ at any normal Indian/Pakistani restaurant in brooklyn. And for that price, i received a burnt, dry, and badly cooked roti.honestly the worst I‚Äôve ever had. When i pointed out the issue, the staff were dismissive and showed zero interest in making it right.The way they treated me was unacceptable. For overpriced, low quality food and disrespectful service, this place is a hard no. Save your time, money, and go somewhere else.
Great food and great customer service -First time trying Indian food and the manager guided me on what to get - very kind and friendly. Best Indian food in Brooklyn - second time coming here
Butter chicken and chicken tikka masala were delicious! Service was fast. Mango lassi was good too.
Delicious food!! Get the aloo mutter gobi
Terrific Indian food at reasonable prices!  We had the chicken biryani, the lamb curry, and garlic naan.  Delicious!  And the owner was super welcoming and attentive.
Best garlic naan and butter chicken in Brooklyn. Kind service!
Good food
Incredible Indian food in Brooklyn, will go again!
The server was friendly but they did not give us tap water. We were charged 4.50 for 3 bottled waters for the two of us. Food was good but nothing incredible.
Good food, especially the samosa chaat. They gave me a bottled water without offering me tap and charged me $1.95 for it.
The young server in school is very respectful. Food is a 10/10 same thing with drinks
The goat curry stirred my emotions and connected me to the cuisine of my ancestors.
Excellent

Very incredible the staff are so nice especially the young male receptionist very hospitable and good boy and the food is super yummy. I would recommend this place to all for authentic indian cuisine. I love the butter chicken and naan here

I had a great experience at this restaurant on Saturday evening, February 1. Even though we arrived late, the staff was very welcoming. One person, in particular, was incredibly kind and made us feel comfortable. Their hospitality and friendly attitude made our visit enjoyable. The food was also delicious, and I would definitely come back again. Highly recommended!

Food is below average. Paneer tikka masala is a big NO. There's a lot of kitchen noise in the dining area. The front receptionist is very loud and weird, asking around if we need more curry or more roti free of cost.

This restaurant is just a big NO for dine in. And personally a no for food quality as well.
Wonderful food and service!
Excellent food. Fresh and not too oily or heavy. Even better service.
Too mild
Always my go to when I need Indian food closeby in the neighborhood. The taste is impeccable!

Great experience. The food came out promptly, and the server was attentive and patient with our big group.

The food was delicious, authentic, and fulfilling. I must say that I initially thought the portions seemed ‚Äúsmall,‚Äù but I was proved wrong. Each one of those bowls was packed with the corresponding sources of protein.

For dessert, we had the Rasmalai, which was delicious and ‚Äúfun,‚Äù and the Gulab Jamun (it looks like cocktail sausages), which you would love if you like desserts on the sweeter side.

We were a group of 6 (we had a reservation) and visited on a Thursday night. The restaurant was mainly quiet (except for us üòÑ), so it felt like a private experience.

Two things I should also mention: they will recommend ordering bottled water as they ‚Äúdon‚Äôt really trust‚Äù the tap water in there, and the menus have corrections done with markers, which sometimes were hard to read or understand.

Ordered via DoorDash. Food came quickly and was very hot. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and they didn‚Äôt slouch with the chicken! Several large, tender pieces filled the serving container. The rice was expertly cooked and delicious. The‚Ä¶

I came in and got seated right away and ordered. Fodd came out in less than 5min and it's hot and fresh. I ordered the chicken biriani spicy and tell me tell you it was spicy and I love spice. Also got the samosas (2) those were hot and I also got the cheese Naan which is to die for. The owner is nice as well, easy to talk to I love this place. Will be coming back again

Really wonderful food, well seasoned, can order spice level to your liking. Huge portions at a great price point (chicken  tikka & white rice @ $14.95). Nice ambiance and the staff went above and beyond. Highly recommend !

Got delivery. Food was amazing, delivered on time, warm and perfectly packaged. Thankful that they respected my non spicy request since I love Indian food but spicy doesn‚Äôt always sit well with me. The butter chicken was fantastic, and the lamb samosas too. This will be my go to Indian food place in the area!

love this place, I got the vegetable lunch box and it was amazing. The staff was super nice and made me smile by how kind they were. my food came out really fast and was still hot by the time I got home. definitely recommend!

Went on a sporadic date here and we decided to dine-in. Service was quick. The food came out promptly and it was delicious. We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and The Butter Chicken w/ a side of garlic naan, and mango chutney.
Warning: No Tap water- he brought us water and charged us for it w/out asking or telling us.

Visiting crown heights from ATL and this was my last stop for a quick Indian craving, and it did not disappoint! I had the chicken tikka masala and this was by far the best I‚Äôve had in Brooklyn. It‚Äôs mom and pop stops like this that I live for ! If you ever are in crown heights it‚Äôs 10/10 recommended for the authentic Indian cuisine. The staff are warm and welcoming and it just is so enthralling!

The food is delicious, and it was ready so promptly! I had a mango lassi, veggie samosas, and the saag paneer, definitely recommend. Photo is mid-meal because I was too excited to dig in straight away.

Nothing but LOVE when you walk through the front door. Greeted by such friendly staff and the place was so well put together and clean! New to the city and love a good butter chicken and naan. One of the best I‚Äôve ever eaten!! Highly recommend, stop by if you‚Äôre in the area!

This place is super cute. The service is amazing and
the food is great. I was craving a nice cozy indian
meal and this place hit the spot. The flavors were on
point, but I do wish it was a bit spicier.
Over all amazing experiences.

Staff was super friendly and also the food is delicious. I ordered the samosa chaat and chicken tikka masala. I even asked if they have Pani Puri and they told me to visit again and they would have it for me! Cook time was crazy fast too!

Great food and amazing service, they‚Äôre extremely fast and super nice. Food has great taste and look, ordered to go and the food was ready relatively quickly. The man at the entrance is really friendly too, greats everyone with a big smile.

Really really good üòä
I tried the chicken tiki masala and a side of naan bread. It was delicious. 10/10
My girlfriend had the shrimp sagoti (pictured below) 10/10
Small but Very comfortable atmosphere , food was great, I felt satisfied and great service was provided, parking was convenient on a Saturday and it was a peaceful dinner out

Food was flavourful and delicious. The porotta and shrimp curry was unexpectedly an amazing combo. Excellent service, although small space, they accommodated to all our needs and were super friendly. 100% would recommend to anyone who wants authentic Indian cuisine!

I don't understand the reviews. The Pakoras were oily, not cooked through, and otherwise bland. The rest of the dishes were serviceable, but not great.  The host only informed me that the credit card machine wasn't working until the end of the meal (I had enough cash to cover it thankfully).  The reviews bear no resemblance to my experience. I've never seen such dissonance.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic Indian food, this is the spot!! I highly recommend the lamb biryani and their chili chicken. The ambiance was very cozy and nice. The food was very very flavorful and the meat was tender and juicy. I highly recommend this place!

First of all this is not indian restaurant. This is Bangladeshi restaurant. We were served food while the guy was cleaning the floor. And one staff person was eating beside us and took our orders. We didn't take packaged bottles, but he anyway charged for it, only removed it after mentioning it. Food was abysmal. The place is dirty.

And all the rating on Google for this restaurant is fake. I came to the botanical garden and believed these ratings on Google and came with my wife. I'm never setting my foot here again.

I‚Äôve eaten in and had take out, food was great both times. Definitely nice to eat there since everything comes out the hottest and freshest. It‚Äôs a little dark inside, with booth and table seating, but nothing too memorable. Server was‚Ä¶
Store is clean, food is good, the staff is friendly and the service is fast. Would definitely come and again. Bring your friends and family, best Indian food I've had in Brooklyn so far.
came here for diwali with friends, loved the chicken biryani :) the owner was so nice and accommodating, great experience
